member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.KestrelServerOptions.MaxPooledStreams
member.summary: Gets or sets value that instructs whether it is safe to pool the Request and Response objects for another request after the Response's OnCompleted callback has fired. When this values is greater than zero, it is not safe to retain references to feature components after this event has fired. Value is zero by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.KestrelServerOptions.MaxPooledHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets value that instructs whether it is safe to pool the Request and Response headers for another request after the Response's OnCompleted callback has fired. When this values is greater than zero, it is not safe to retain references to feature components after this event has fired. Value is zero by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.KestrelServerOptions.ShutdownTimeout
member.summary: The amount of time after the server begins shutting down before connections will be forcefully closed. By default, Kestrel will wait 5 seconds for any ongoing requests to complete before terminating the connection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Filter.SocketInputStream
member.summary: This is a write-only stream that copies what is written into a object. This is used as an argument to so input filtered by a ConnectionFilter (e.g. SslStream) can be consumed by .

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.DateHeaderValueManager
member.summary: Manages the generation of the date header value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.DateHeaderValueManager.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.DateHeaderValueManager.GetDateHeaderValue
member.summary: Returns a value representing the current server date/time for use in the HTTP "Date" response header in accordance with http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.18

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.DateHeaderValueManager.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the current instance of .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.DateHeaderValueManager.StartTimer
member.summary: Starts the timer

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.DateHeaderValueManager.StopTimer
member.summary: Stops the timer

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.DateHeaderValueManager.PrepareDateValues
member.summary: Starts the timer if it's turned off, or sets the datevalues to the current time if disposed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.DateHeaderValueManager.SetDateValues(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Sets date values from a provided ticks value
member.param: A DateTimeOffset value

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.Frame.Start
member.summary: Called once by Connection class to begin the RequestProcessingAsync loop.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.Frame.Stop
member.summary: Should be called when the server wants to initiate a shutdown. The Task returned will become complete when the RequestProcessingAsync function has exited. It is expected that Stop will be called on all active connections, and Task.WaitAll() will be called on every return value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.Frame.Abort
member.summary: Immediate kill the connection and poison the request and response streams.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.Frame.RequestProcessingAsync
member.summary: Primary loop which consumes socket input, parses it for protocol framing, and invokes the application delegate for as long as the socket is intended to remain open. The resulting Task from this loop is preserved in a field which is used when the server needs to drain and close all currently active connections.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.Frame`1.RequestProcessingAsync
member.summary: Primary loop which consumes socket input, parses it for protocol framing, and invokes the application delegate for as long as the socket is intended to remain open. The resulting Task from this loop is preserved in a field which is used when the server needs to drain and close all currently active connections.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.ISocketOutput
member.summary: Operations performed for buffered socket output

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.ISocketOutput.ProducingStart
member.summary: Returns an iterator pointing to the tail of the response buffer. Response data can be appended manually or by using . Be careful to ensure all appended blocks are backed by a .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.ISocketOutput.ProducingComplete(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator)
member.summary: Commits the response data appended to the iterator returned from . All the data up to will be included in the response. A write operation isn't guaranteed to be scheduled unless or is called afterwards.
member.param: Points to the end of the committed data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.UrlPathDecoder.Unescape(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator)
member.summary: Unescapes the string between given memory iterators in place.
member.param: The iterator points to the beginning of the sequence.
The iterator points to the byte behind the end of the sequence.
member.returns: The iterator points to the byte behind the end of the processed sequence.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.UrlPathDecoder.DecodeCore(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator@,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator@,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator)
member.summary: Unescape the percent-encodings
member.param: The iterator point to the first % char
The place to write to
The end of the sequence

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.UrlPathDecoder.UnescapePercentEncoding(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator@,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator)
member.summary:
Read the percent-encoding and try unescape it.
The operation first peek at the character the iterator points at. If it is % the is then moved on to scan the following to characters. If the two following characters are hexadecimal literals they will be unescaped and the value will be returned.
If the first character is not % the iterator will be removed beyond the location of % and -1 will be returned.
If the following two characters can't be successfully unescaped the iterator will be move behind the % and -1 will be returned.
member.param: The value to read
The end of the sequence
member.returns: The unescaped byte if success. Otherwise return -1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Http.UrlPathDecoder.ReadHex(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator@,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator)
member.summary:
Read the next char and convert it into hexadecimal value.
The iterator will be moved to the next byte no matter no matter whether the operation successes.
member.param: The value to read
The end of the sequence
member.returns: The hexadecimal value if successes, otherwise -1.

member.summary: Retrieves the current system time in UTC.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPool
member.summary: Used to allocate and distribute re-usable blocks of memory.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPool._blockStride
member.summary: The gap between blocks' starting address. 4096 is chosen because most operating systems are 4k pages in size and alignment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPool._blockUnused
member.summary: The last 64 bytes of a block are unused to prevent CPU from pre-fetching the next 64 byte into it's memory cache. See https://github.com/aspnet/KestrelHttpServer/issues/117 and https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L7zSU9HI-6I

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPool._blockCount
member.summary: Allocating 32 contiguous blocks per slab makes the slab size 128k. This is larger than the 85k size which will place the memory in the large object heap. This means the GC will not try to relocate this array, so the fact it remains pinned does not negatively affect memory management's compactification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPool._blockLength
member.summary: 4096 - 64 gives you a blockLength of 4032 usable bytes per block.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPool.MaxPooledBlockLength
member.summary: Max allocation block size for pooled blocks, larger values can be leased but they will be disposed after use rather than returned to the pool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPool._slabLength
member.summary: 4096 * 32 gives you a slabLength of 128k contiguous bytes allocated per slab

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPool._blocks
member.summary: Thread-safe collection of blocks which are currently in the pool. A slab will pre-allocate all of the block tracking objects and add them to this collection. When memory is requested it is taken from here first, and when it is returned it is re-added.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPool._slabs
member.summary: Thread-safe collection of slabs which have been allocated by this pool. As long as a slab is in this collection and slab.IsActive, the blocks will be added to _blocks when returned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPool._disposedValue
member.summary: This is part of implementing the IDisposable pattern.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPool.Lease(System.Int32)
member.summary: Called to take a block from the pool.
member.param: The block returned must be at least this size. It may be larger than this minimum size, and if so, the caller may write to the block's entire size rather than being limited to the minumumSize requested.
member.returns: The block that is reserved for the called. It must be passed to Return when it is no longer being used.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPool.AllocateSlab
member.summary: Internal method called when a block is requested and the pool is empty. It allocates one additional slab, creates all of the block tracking objects, and adds them all to the pool.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPool.Return(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock)
member.summary: Called to return a block to the pool. Once Return has been called the memory no longer belongs to the caller, and Very Bad Things will happen if the memory is read of modified subsequently. If a caller fails to call Return and the block tracking object is garbage collected, the block tracking object's finalizer will automatically re-create and return a new tracking object into the pool. This will only happen if there is a bug in the server, however it is necessary to avoid leaving "dead zones" in the slab due to lost block tracking objects.
member.param: The block to return. It must have been acquired by calling Lease on the same memory pool instance.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock
member.summary: Block tracking object used by the byte buffer memory pool. A slab is a large allocation which is divided into smaller blocks. The individual blocks are then treated as independant array segments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock._pinHandle
member.summary: If this block represents a one-time-use memory object, this GCHandle will hold that memory object at a fixed address so it can be used in native operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock._dataArrayPtr
member.summary: Native address of the first byte of this block's Data memory. It is null for one-time-use memory, or copied from the Slab's ArrayPtr for a slab-block segment. The byte it points to corresponds to Data.Array[0], and in practice you will always use the _dataArrayPtr + Start or _dataArrayPtr + End, which point to the start of "active" bytes, or point to just after the "active" bytes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock.Data
member.summary: The array segment describing the range of memory this block is tracking. The caller which has leased this block may only read and modify the memory in this range.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock.#ctor
member.summary: This object cannot be instantiated outside of the static Create method

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock.Pool
member.summary: Back-reference to the memory pool which this block was allocated from. It may only be returned to this pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock.Slab
member.summary: Back-reference to the slab from which this block was taken, or null if it is one-time-use memory.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock.Array
member.summary: Convenience accessor

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock.Start
member.summary: The Start represents the offset into Array where the range of "active" bytes begins. At the point when the block is leased the Start is guaranteed to be equal to Array.Offset. The value of Start may be assigned anywhere between Data.Offset and Data.Offset + Data.Count, and must be equal to or less than End.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock.End
member.summary: The End represents the offset into Array where the range of "active" bytes ends. At the point when the block is leased the End is guaranteed to be equal to Array.Offset. The value of Start may be assigned anywhere between Data.Offset and Data.Offset + Data.Count, and must be equal to or less than End.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock.Next
member.summary: Reference to the next block of data when the overall "active" bytes spans multiple blocks. At the point when the block is leased Next is guaranteed to be null. Start, End, and Next are used together in order to create a linked-list of discontiguous working memory. The "active" memory is grown when bytes are copied in, End is increased, and Next is assigned. The "active" memory is shrunk when bytes are consumed, Start is increased, and blocks are returned to the pool.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock.Pin
member.summary: Called to ensure that a block is pinned, and return the pointer to the native address of the first byte of this block's Data memory. Arriving data is read into Pin() + End. Outgoing data is read from Pin() + Start.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock.Reset
member.summary: called when the block is returned to the pool. mutable values are re-assigned to their guaranteed initialized state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock.ToString
member.summary: ToString overridden for debugger convenience. This displays the "active" byte information in this block as ASCII characters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolBlock.GetIterator
member.summary: acquires a cursor pointing into this block at the Start of "active" byte information

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator.FindFirstEqualByte(System.Numerics.Vector{System.Byte}@)
member.summary: Find first byte
member.returns: The first index of the result vector

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator.Put(System.Byte)
member.summary: Save the data at the current location then move to the next available space.
member.param: The byte to be saved.
member.returns: true if the operation successes. false if can't find available space.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIteratorExtensions.GetKnownMethod(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator@,System.String@)
member.summary: Checks that up to 8 bytes from correspond to a known HTTP method.
member.remarks: A "known HTTP method" can be an HTTP method name defined in the HTTP/1.1 RFC. Since all of those fit in at most 8 bytes, they can be optimally looked up by reading those bytes as a long. Once in that format, it can be checked against the known method. The Known Methods (CONNECT, DELETE, GET, HEAD, PATCH, POST, PUT, OPTIONS, TRACE) are all less than 8 bytes and will be compared with the required space. A mask is used if the Known method is less than 8 bytes. To optimize performance the GET method will be checked first.
member.param: The iterator from which to start the known string lookup.
If we found a valid method, then scan will be updated to new position
A reference to a pre-allocated known string, if the input matches any.
member.returns: true if the input matches a known string, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIteratorExtensions.GetKnownVersion(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolIterator@,System.String@)
member.summary: Checks 9 bytes from correspond to a known HTTP version.
member.remarks: A "known HTTP version" Is is either HTTP/1.0 or HTTP/1.1. Since those fit in 8 bytes, they can be optimally looked up by reading those bytes as a long. Once in that format, it can be checked against the known versions. The Known versions will be checked with the required '\r'. To optimize performance the HTTP/1.1 will be checked first.
member.param: The iterator from which to start the known string lookup.
If we found a valid method, then scan will be updated to new position
A reference to a pre-allocated known string, if the input matches any.
member.returns: true if the input matches a known string, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolSlab
member.summary: Slab tracking object used by the byte buffer memory pool. A slab is a large allocation which is divided into smaller blocks. The individual blocks are then treated as independant array segments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolSlab._gcHandle
member.summary: This handle pins the managed array in memory until the slab is disposed. This prevents it from being relocated and enables any subsections of the array to be used as native memory pointers to P/Invoked API calls.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolSlab.Array
member.summary: The managed memory allocated in the large object heap.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolSlab.ArrayPtr
member.summary: The native memory pointer of the pinned Array. All block native addresses are pointers into the memory ranging from ArrayPtr to ArrayPtr + Array.Length

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolSlab.IsActive
member.summary: True as long as the blocks from this slab are to be considered returnable to the pool. In order to shrink the memory pool size an entire slab must be removed. That is done by (1) setting IsActive to false and removing the slab from the pool's _slabs collection, (2) as each block currently in use is Return()ed to the pool it will be allowed to be garbage collected rather than re-pooled, and (3) when all block tracking objects are garbage collected and the slab is no longer references the slab will be garbage collected and the memory unpinned will be unpinned by the slab's Dispose.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Infrastructure.MemoryPoolSlab._disposedValue
member.summary: Part of the IDisposable implementation

member.summary: Provides access to the normal system clock.
